newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia cuts internal coffee price.
newsitem.headline: Colombia cuts internal coffee price.

text.p: Colombia cut its internal coffee price to 445,000 pesos per 125-kg load Friday, just three days after raising the price for the 15th time since Jan. 31, a spokesman for the National Coffee Growers' Federation said.

The price cut was the third since Jan. 31, when a new sliding-scale formula was introduced to calculate payments to Colombian growers and help the domestic price track the sharp run-up in world prices.
The new price, which will remain in effect until Friday of next week, is 2.19 percent lower than the record high price of 455,000 pesos per 125-kg load that was set on June 3.
It was based on the lowest average trading price of Colombian coffee in New York over the past week, which the federation spokesman said had been calculated at $269.77 per pound.
Previously, the internal price formula was based on the average trading price per pound, rather than the lowest average price. ((-- Javier Mozzo, Bogota newsroom, 571 610 7944))
